By  Dan PattersonSeptember  

A Tuesday afternoon accident near Lucinda Avenue sent a bicyclist to the hospital PERIOD

Lt PERIOD Jim Kayes of the DeKalb police department said Alexandria Vernasco  of Westmont was riding on the sidewalk when she came to the entrance in front of Village Commons Bookstore parking lot in the  block of Lucinda Avenue PERIOD

Police said Dave Jennings  of  Greenbrier Apt PERIOD A who also is an assistant coach for the NIU womens trackandfield team was in his truck waiting to turn left from the drive PERIOD

I looked left and I looked right Jennings said PERIOD I didnt see anything coming and then I heard something hit my truck. he said he didnt know he had collided with Vernasco until after a group of people ran into the street and stopped him as he was turning PERIOD

According to the police report Vernasco was knocked over and pinned beneath the front end of the bike PERIOD

Kayes said Vernascos front bike tire was hit by the front of the truck forcing her to the ground PERIOD He said both Jennings and Vernasco had been stopped at the drive PERIOD Jennings then pulled ahead when he thought he had the right of way Kayes said PERIOD

Kayes said he could not comment on the condition of Vernasco but said she had been taken to Kishwaukee Community Hospital PERIOD

Of course I feel very sorry that she got hurt Jennings said PERIOD I dont even know what I should say. jennings was cited for failing to yield to a bicyclist PERIOD
